creator: carnold@apache.org
text:
On 30 Nov 2005 in
http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?l=log4j-dev&m=113339000402475&w=2, Lara DAbreo writes:

   Hi all, 
   
  Attatched for review and possible inclusion to the log4j project is an
RSS/Atom appender. The zip contains the appender src, some testcases and
required libs (JDOM,log4j 1.3 alpha7 and ROME).   
  The appender outputs log events to an RSS or ATOM feed. It can deal with the
enclosing XML tags and recreate a feed from scratch or append to an existing
file. It supports rudimentary event buffering and configurable event/entry
mapping. The Appender works with Java 1.3/1.4. The details of the underlying
feed formats are delegated down to ROME - https://rome.dev.java.net. (Apache
V2), which is turn uses JDOM - http://www.jdom.org/. (An apache V2 like license)  
  regards,
  Lara
  ldabreotech@yahoo.com 

------

Contribution will be initially added to
http://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/sandbox/log4j/contribs/LaraDAbreo.

creator: carnold@apache.org
